description:
Doctor Doofenshmirtz, after creating a laser beam, turns home appliances into troops to form his private army. Phineas and Ferb have to defeat the doctor and his minions to save the city of Danville.

Phineas and Ferb: Day of Doofenshmirtz is an action game where players can play as Phineas, Ferb and Perry. They explore 3D environments and use weapons such as the Sport Launcher to defeat enemies like the robot microwave or walking laundry machine. During the game, the players face boss encounters and also fly with Agent P as a side-scroller through the city to hunt Doctor Doofenshmirtz and end his crazy plan.

With the coins collected during the game dances for robots can be unlocked. Using Augmented Reality these robots dance on any real world surface. Also, any collected coins along with junk and batteries can be used to unlock new shots for the Sport Launcher in the workshop.
title: Phineas and Ferb: Day of Doofenshmirtz

description:
The players go on an adventure with Kermit the Frog, Miss Piggy, The Great Gonzo, Animal... and bring "order" to the Hollywood stage. They experience famous movies from the Muppets point-of-view and engage in classic jump 'n run platforming action using the unique touch controls of the PlayStation Vita.

With the help of the PS Vita's touch control, the players will solve interactive puzzles in the various levels, such as connect the sphere of the same color without crossing the connection of another colored sphere.

During the game the players will visit the set of famous movies themes such as Pirates, Western, Horror Houses and more. They will hunt for golden tickets and movie rolls. Each stage features a unique item which unlocks new ways to complete the stage and discover more secret items to collect.
title: The Muppets: Movie Adventures

description:
In Looney Tunes Galactic Sports the Martians call the Looney Tunes to participate in the Galactic Games. They get to compete in six different sports to become the best athlete in the galaxy. Players can also challenge friends via multiplayer. Available characters include Bugs Bunny, Daffy Duck and Porky Pig.

The game makes use of the different controls for the different events. Some sports use the buttons, other the touch pad and archery for example uses the PS Vita's gyroscope to aim. The available sports include a racing game (similar to an endless runner, with dodging), archery, golf, boxing, trap shooting (with gameplay similar to Galaga and a aquatic sport based on collecting balls from a pool and returning them to a base, competing against an opponent.
title: Looney Tunes Galactic Sports

description:
Metrico is a puzzle platformer set in abstract worlds based on infographics. The player guides a character using a side view through an environment that reacts to actions, movement and input. Most of the times the character does not need to touch anything in the environment for it to react. Shapes start to move, numbers appear, platforms appear or disappear and so on. To get through the puzzle sequences the player always needs to experiment with the effects of input and then find a way to move platforms or overcome obstacles. Initially all reactions are based on movement and jumping, but later on several Vita-specific types of input are used, such as the touchpad, camera and motion functionality.

There are about 60 puzzle sequences divided over six worlds each with a different theme. The game never provides hints, but often there are clues in the environment, such as numbers adding up to show how shapes can move or percentages changing based on movement. In later levels sequences sometimes have multiple types of checkpoints that can be used to respawn at a further position than when initially starting the sequence. In some levels projectiles can be shot to reveal or hide platforms, or alter parts of the environment. The back camera is for instance used to capture certain colours in the real world to solve puzzles in the game. At the end of each world there is a choice between two doors to progress and the choices by players worldwide are compared.
title: Metrico

description:
Ten By Eight is a puzzle game where you have to clear titles. You can clear as few as three tiles, but also chain up the longest match you can.

You can use wildcard star tiles to link a chain of one color to a chain of another color. There are three modes - Timed Mode asks you how many points you can make in three minutes, Zen Mode asks you to hang out and make your own challenges (try clearing all eighty tiles in one action), and Endless Mode.
title: Ten by Eight

description:
In a series of space colonies at the edge of the galaxy a mysterious disease drives people to uncontrollable rage. Only the healing power of song by the idol group Walküre can calm them, with the mercenary soldier force Delta Flight of Chaos defending them during concerts. At the same time the Aerial Knights of Windermere Kingdom exploit the disease to establish their rule over the colonies and their control over ancient Protoculture. Across many skies the two forces will clash to determine the fate of the cluster.

Macross Delta Scramble is an action game set during the first season of the Macross Delta anime. In storyline missions the player takes control of two pairs of pilots: Fan Vernalotte and Hans Schwalm of Chaos, and Victor Harmstadt and Domenic Udetto of the Windermere Kingdom. Both pairs are original characters created for this game who fight alongside the original anime characters of their respective sides, and their names and callsigns can be changed by the player. The player switches back and forth between the factions while playing to see the full story. Outside of the storyline are Extra missions which function as both training missions as well as fanservice events where the heroes of past Macross shows cameo and can be fought.

Completing missions rewards currency and unlocks new pilots, mecha, and support characters in the shop. Purchased units can only be used by their respective force in Windemere and Chaos storyline missions, but all units, including cameo units, can be used interchangeably in Extra missions. Before missions the player selects a pilot and mecha, a co-pilot and their mecha, and up to five support characters. Mecha accumulate TP while being used in stages, which can then be spent to tune up its stats, such as higher top speed or more weapon ammunition. Each mecha has additional paint jobs, and may have selectable option parts like boosters or armor plating. Pilots gain XP from completing stages, and leveling up increases their base stats and passive skills. The lead support character determines the effect of the Support Skill, such as unlimited ammunition or healing, as well as which song plays for the skill. The remaining four support characters provide passive stat boosts, and if the characters are related, such as selecting all five members of Walküre or a pilot and their co-pilot, there will be an additional set bonus.

During a stage the three forms of a Variable Fighter can be swapped between at will: Fighter mode has the highest speed, but limited maneuverability and no ability to defend or auto-target incoming missiles. Gerwalk mode offers the highest maneuverability and ranged offensive options, while Battroid mode trades off flight mode for access to melee attacks, defending, and the most effective anti-missile defense. Weapons have unlimited ammunition, but finite magazines, and will be unavailable while reloading. Successfully hitting opponents builds the SP gauge which can be spent on either the special ability of the equipped Support Skill, or a very powerful Special Attack which is unique to each pilot. Cutscenes and radio chatter play during missions, both of which are voiced by the original cast members.
title: Macross Delta Scramble

description:
The third game in the Fuuraiki (風雨来記) visual novel series returns back to its roots and takes place on Hokkaido again, the northern island of Japan. Much like in previous games in the series, the game features live photos as background with 2D anime characters over the backgrounds, integrated as part of the photo during CG events. The game also offers high degree of freedom during exploration or location similar to that in previous installments.

Fuuraiki 3 is an updated and enhanced port of the original game with higher resolution graphics and additional content.

New content in comparison to original PSX release includes:

  • New heroine, Akari Yukishiro
  • Bonus scenario featuring new heroine, and new random scenario
  • Enhanced gameplay with new places to visit on the map
title: Fūraiki 3

description: Nisekoi Yomeiri!? is a romantic visual novel based on Nisekoi manga and animated TV series. The game features an original story in the series that takes off right after the animated TV series ended. The protagonists controls Raku, son of a Yakuza family leader, who refuses to follow in his father's steps due to his kind personality and prefers to find a decent job. In his adventures he will meet many heroines from the franchise with whom he can get romantically entangled. Gameplay is that of a typical visual novel with characters and on-screen dialogue box over background image. Making choices leads to branching in the story which can lead to one of several different endings.
title: Nisekoi Yomeiri!?

description:
The game is mainly a visual novel, requiring little player involvement as the story is told and its progress is mostly told through its text. The player will use many different roles varying from Daichi Manatsu, Hana Mutou, Teppei Arashi, Akari Yomatsuri, Amara, Moco and the rest of the Planetary Gears, and can communicate with the other roles in a typical slice of life environment across various paths, aside from the darker and more battle-oriented style of the main game.

The game contains several outcomes for each player, leading to probable several very odd partnerships including Daichi and Moco being together. Such ends also have gay romantic interactions such as Moco with Ai, or Baku with Amara.

Certain game modes include "Touch Mode", where players may communicate with characters by "touching" them with the controller of the screen, and a minigame named "Mind Puzzle", where the player is forced to play through the different characters to complete. The mind puzzle will use and combine items from different characters to further progress through the puzzle.
title: Captain Earth: Mind Labyrinth

description:
Doko Demo Issyo & Koneko Mo Issyo Pack is a downloadable bundle collecting the PlayStation title Doko Demo Issyo and its expansion, Koneko Mo Issyo. Both titles are available on the PS Vita for the first time through this release.

Doko Demo Issyo is a hybrid of virtual pet and chat toy. It features several characters collectively referred to as “Pokepi” (Pocket People), including Toro Inoue who went on to be a PlayStation mascot in Japan. It revolves around the use of the PocketStation accessory to take your Pokepi around with you, where you can chat and interact with them.

Koneko Mo Issyo is an expansion disc, originally released separately on PlayStation, which adds a version of the popular Toro character, but as a kitten.
title: Doko Demo Issyo & Koneko Mo Issyo Pack

description:
Based on manga and anime series Saki, this game follows high school student Saki and her school's mahjong club throughout a nationwide tournament of traditional four-player Japanese mahjong. The twist: not just Saki herself but every person in this tournament has supernatural powers which affect the flow of the game in different, normally-impossible ways. It features a cast of more than 55 playable characters, each with their own unique ability. As players win rounds, they gain points that can be used to power up characters' abilities. Players also have the choice to play with abilities turned off, at which point the game becomes a more traditional mahjong simulation.

This edition, Plus, folds in a few enhancements that had been previously released as updates for the original game.
title: Saki: Zengoku-hen Plus

It features a large cast of many playable characters, each with their own unique ability. As players win rounds, they gain points that can be used to power up characters' abilities. Players also have the choice to play with abilities turned off, at which point the game becomes a more traditional mahjong simulation.

description: Supremacy MMA: Unrestricted is a port of Supremacy MMA. It adds several additional venues, two exclusive fighters (Jason Yee and Novell Bell) and both the pre-order fighters that were offered as DLC for the original version (Shane del Rosario and Bao Quach).
title: Supremacy MMA: Unrestricted

description: An updated port of Ar nosurge: Ode to an Unborn Star. This release contains a new tutorial mode, new dialogue events, allows three additional supporting characters to participate in Purification Ceremonies, and includes all of the PS3's DLC costume packs as part of the base game. Three free DLC packs were also made exclusive for the Vita release.
title: Ar nosurge Plus: Ode to an Unborn Star
